snippet: There are good reasons ground meat shows up in traditional recipes the world over, and it deserves a respected place at our collective table.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Brian Halweil, editor of Edible East End and publisher of Edible New York and Edible Brooklyn, and Danielle Nierenberg, director of Nourishing the Planet, praises the virtues of ground meat, which is often healthier, cheaper and more environmentally friendly than other cuts of meat, provided that the meat does not come from factory farms.

byline.original: By BRIAN HALWEIL and DANIELLE NIERENBERG

lead_paragraph: There are good reasons ground meat shows up in traditional recipes the world over, and it deserves a respected place at our collective table.

headline.seo: The Kindest Cut of Meat Is Ground
